dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4469 RH: No Fuel Credits for Batteries Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Pence introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce
Additional sponsors: Mrs. Miller-Meeks and Mr. Griffith
Reported from the Committee on Energy and Commerce; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To clarify that eRINs are not authorized for purposes of satisfying the volume of renewable fuel that needs to be contained in transportation fuel for purposes of the Renewable Fuel Program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Fuel Credits for Batteries Act of 2023.

subsection.text: The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency—

paragraph.text: may not authorize the generation of credits for electricity generated from renewable fuel for purposes of satisfying the volume of renewable fuel that needs to be contained in transportation fuel for purposes of section 211(o)(2) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)(2)); and
shall prohibit the use or transfer of any such credits that were generated before the date of enactment of this Act.
The term renewable fuel has the meaning given such term under section 211(o)(1)(J) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)(1)(J)).
The term transportation fuel has the meaning given such term under section 211(o)(1)(L) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)(1)(L)).

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
